p: 3. “Pregnant women were more likely than non-pregnant women to be HBsAg-positivity 5.5% versus 3.0%), but the difference was not statistically significant after adjustment for age (P=0.06)”. The study might be underpowered to make this assessment, (only N = 8 women were pregnant); the result might have been statistically significant with a higher sample size. Besides, P= 0.06 is pretty close to the significance level. I would address this obvious limitation in the text. Moreover, did the authors consider the following covariates: the number of previous deliveries, and hospital stay, which might confound the relationship?
